entry.title: What's the difference between CI and CD (and the other CD)?
entry.content:
• Abstract from RedHat [What is CI/CD?]

    • Continuous integration (CI) helps developers merge their code changes back to a shared branch, or “trunk,” more frequently—sometimes even daily. If automated testing discovers a conflict between new and existing code, CI makes it easier to fix those bugs quickly and often.
    • Continuous delivery (CD), the goal of continuous delivery is to have a codebase that is always ready for deployment to a production environment.
    • Continuous deployment (CD), as an extension of continuous delivery, continuous deployment means that a developer’s change to a cloud application could go live within minutes of writing it (assuming it passes automated testing). This makes it much easier to continuously receive and incorporate user feedback.

 

  • Relationship Diagram

    1. Red Hat, Inc.

      Source: https://www.redhat.com/en/topics/devops/what-is-ci-cd

    2. Code Maze

      Source: https://www.codeproject.com/articles/1078439/what-is-continuous-integration-and-why-do-you-need

Reference
https://www.redhat.com/en/topics/devops/what-is-ci-cd
http://devopstechie.com/continuous-integration-vs-continuous-delivery-vs-continuous-deployment/
entry.summary:
• Abstract from RedHat [What is CI/CD?]

    • Continuous integration (CI) helps developers merge their code changes back to a shared branch, or “trunk,” more frequently—sometimes even daily. If automated testing discovers a conflict between new and existing code, CI makes it easier to fix those bugs quickly and often.
    • Continuous delivery (CD), the goal of continuous delivery is to have a codebase that is always ready for deployment to a production environment.
    • Continuous deployment (CD), as an extension of continuous delivery, continuous deployment means that a developer’s change to a cloud application could go live within minutes of writing it (assuming it passes automated testing). This makes it much easier to continuously receive and incorporate user feedback.

entry.title: Get Started with Docker on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS
entry.content:
“We have a complete container solution for you - no matter who you are and where you are on your containerization journey.” - Docker Inc.

  1. sudo apt install docker.io

  2. Manage Docker as a non-root user

  3. docker search hello-world

  4. docker pull hello-world

  5. docker run hello-world

Reference
Docker Official Website
Docker Docs
Docker Hub
entry.summary: “We have a complete container solution for you - no matter who you are and where you are on your containerization journey.” - Docker Inc.

entry.title: Building a Spring Boot Application Using Intellij IDEA
entry.content:
“Spring makes programming Java quicker, easier, and safer for everybody. Spring’s focus on speed, simplicity, and productivity has made it the world’s most popular Java framework.” - spring.io

  1. Install IntelliJ IDEA
  2. Start IntelliJ IDEA and Create New Project
  3. Select Spring Initializr -> Project SDK




    and Next.
  4. Project Settings (Optional)

    and Next.
  5. Select Dependencies (Enable Web -> Spring Web Here)

    and Next.
  6. Select Project Location
  7. Setup Maven (a build automation tool used primarily for Java projects)
    (1). File -> Settings

    (2). Build, Execution and Deployment -> Build Tools -> Maven

    (3). Download Apache Maven (https://maven.apache.org/) and Create a Folder for Maven Repository

    (4). Setup Apache Maven folder -> conf folder -> settings.xml


    (5). Fill Maven home directory, User settings file and Local repository in Intellij IDEA settings.

    Apply and OK
    (6). We Got Some Error Information from Default Maven Settings Here

    (7). Click Reload All Maven Projects on Top-Right Corner, and Wait for Maven Import Completion

    (8). Errors were resolved
  8. Create a Simple Web Application
  9. Click Run DemoApplication Button on Top-Right Corner (Shift + F10)
  10. Done!

Reference
IntelliJ IDEA Official Website
Spring Official Website
Apache Maven Official Website
entry.summary: “Spring makes programming Java quicker, easier, and safer for everybody. Spring’s focus on speed, simplicity, and productivity has made it the world’s most popular Java framework.” - spring.io

entry.title: Access Localhost from Anywhere with Ngrok
entry.content:
Public URLs for exposing your local web server.

  1. https://ngrok.com/download

  2. Example:
    (1). Usage on Windows (my host machine).

    (2). To expose web server with a HTTP tunnel on port 23000 on Windows.

    ngrok http 23000

    (3). We can surf the web from anywhere now.

Reference
ngrok Official Website
entry.summary: Public URLs for exposing your local web server.

entry.title: Installation of React on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS
entry.content:
A JavaScript library for building user interfaces.

  1. Install Node.js

  2. sudo npm install -g create-react-app

  3. cd hello-app; npm start

  4. Done!

Reference:
React Official Website
Install And Setup React App on Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS
Thumbnail
entry.summary: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces.

entry.title: Installation of Node.js on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS
entry.content:
Node.js® is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome’s V8 JavaScript engine.

  1. sudo apt-get install curl

  2. curl -sL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_12.x | sudo -E bash -

  3. sudo apt-get install -y nodejs

  4. sudo npm install npm@latest -g

Reference:
Node.js Official Website
Install And Setup React App on Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS
entry.summary: Node.js® is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome’s V8 JavaScript engine.

entry.title: Online Markdown Editor
entry.content:
• https://pandao.github.io/editor.md/en.html
  • https://dillinger.io/
  • https://stackedit.io/app

Sample (from Editor.md)

Features

  • Support Standard Markdown / CommonMark and GFM(GitHub Flavored Markdown);
  • Full-featured: Real-time Preview, Image (cross-domain) upload, Preformatted text/Code blocks/Tables insert, Code fold, Search replace, Read only, Themes, Multi-languages, L18n, HTML entities, Code syntax highlighting…;
  • Markdown Extras : Support ToC (Table of Contents), Emoji, Task lists, @Links…;
  • Compatible with all major browsers (IE8+), compatible Zepto.js and iPad;
  • Support identification, interpretation, fliter of the HTML tags;
  • Support TeX (LaTeX expressions, Based on KaTeX), Flowchart and Sequence Diagram of Markdown extended syntax;
  • Support AMD/CMD (Require.js & Sea.js) Module Loader, and Custom/define editor plugins;

Editor.md

##Headers (Underline)

H1 Header (Underline)

H2 Header (Underline)

Characters

Strikethrough Strikethrough (when enable html tag decode.)
Italic Italic
Emphasis Emphasis
Emphasis Italic Emphasis Italic

Superscript: X2，Subscript: O2

Abbreviation(link HTML abbr tag)

The HTML specification is maintained by the W3C.

Blockquotes

Blockquotes

Paragraphs and Line Breaks

“Blockquotes Blockquotes”, Link。

Links

Links

Links with title

<link> : https://github.com

Reference link

GFM a-tail link @pandao

Code Blocks (multi-language) & highlighting

Inline code

$ npm install marked

Code Blocks (Indented style)

Indented 4 spaces, like <pre> (Preformatted Text).

<?php    echo "Hello world!";?>

Code Blocks (Preformatted text):

| First Header  | Second Header || ------------- | ------------- || Content Cell  | Content Cell  || Content Cell  | Content Cell  |

Javascript　

HTML code

Images

Image:

Follow your heart.

图为：厦门白城沙滩 Xiamen

图片加链接 (Image + Link)：

图为：李健首张专辑《似水流年》封面

Lists

Unordered list (-)

  • Item A
  • Item B
  • Item C

Unordered list (*)

  • Item A
  • Item B
  • Item C

Unordered list (plus sign and nested)

  • Item A
  • Item B
    • Item B 1
    • Item B 2
    • Item B 3
  • Item C
    • Item C 1
    • Item C 2
    • Item C 3

Ordered list

  1. Item A
  2. Item B
  3. Item C

Tables

Content CellContent Cell

X² Y³ ¾ ¼ × ÷ »

*literal asterisks*

  • :smiley: @mentions, :smiley: #refs, links, formatting, and tags supported :editormd-logo:;
  • list syntax required (any unordered or ordered list supported) :editormd-logo-3x:;
  • [ ] :smiley: this is a complete item :smiley:;
  • []this is an incomplete item test link :fa-star: @pandao;
  • [ ]this is an incomplete item :fa-star: :fa-gear:;
    • :smiley: this is an incomplete item test link :fa-star: :fa-gear:;
